newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Tyndall rises after Barrons report.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Tyndall rises after Barrons report.

text.p: The shares of financial services group Tyndall Australia Ltd were firmer in Monday afternoon trade after a report in Barrons newspaper on Sunday which said the stock was undervalued.
At 2.10 p.m. (0410 GMT), Tyndall shares were 15 cents higher at a new year high of A$2.00 but by 2.30 p.m. (0430 GMT) they had retreated to A$1.96, on turnover of 145,527 shares.
The report quoted Mark Hake, a principal of Hake Capital Management, an investment group targeting small-capitalisation around the world judged to radically undervalued.
"Tyndall is selling for about A$1.70 and we think it's worth well north of A$2.00," the report said.
Hake also recommended the stock of drilling company Australian Oil & Gas Corp Ltd and said the stock was "trading for about two-thirds of book (value) and we think it has a lot more to go."
At 2.10 p.m. (0410 GMT), Australian Oil & Gas shares were five cents firmer at A$1.20.
